text: I know that campaigns can seem small, and even silly. Trivial things become big distractions. Serious issues become sound bites. And the truth gets buried under an avalanche of money and advertising. If you're sick of hearing me approve this message, believe me - so am I.
author: Barack Obama

text: You can choose a future where more Americans have the chance to gain the skills they need to compete, no matter how old they are or how much money they have. Education was the gateway to opportunity for me. It was the gateway for Michelle. And now more than ever, it is the gateway to a middle-class life.
author: Barack Obama

text: I've never preached one sermon on money, on just finances. I want to stay away from it.
author: Joel Osteen

text: In liberal logic, if life is unfair then the answer is to turn more tax money over to politicians, to spend in ways that will increase their chances of getting reelected.
author: Thomas Sowell

text: I don't believe we are supposed to go through life defeated and not having enough money to pay our bills or send our kids to college.
author: Joel Osteen
